RelatedSentence: The Illinois resident who previously tested positive for Middle Eastern Respiratory Syndrome , or MERS , antibodies in his blood , has since tested negative for his ability to spread the virus , Illinois officials said Monday .
Health officials first tested the individual , who has not been named , using oral and nasal swabs for active MERS - CoV infection on May 5 .
On May 16 , a blood test result was positive for the Illinois resident , showing that he had antibodies to MERS - CoV .
